result.execSummary:
The defendant Pearl S. Tia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Racine case 14CF895 and Consecutive to Kenosha files 13CF520 & 13CF1366.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD BY DA   plus surcharges.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 031716 paid by county $63.00 for files 15cf498, 15cf518, 15cf611
3/17/16 - Sentencing Hearing
Zero restitution.
For Restitution Order
DA responds to query about restitution that there is none; requested determination to be zero for judicial approval.
Concurrent to Racine case 14CF895 and Consecutive to Kenosha files 13CF520 & 13CF1366.

Discussion held off the record with ADA McNeill, Atty Bielski and Judge Wagner; the JOC is to be amended in that the sentences are to be consecutive (not concurrent) to 13CF520 and 13CF1366, all other orders remain unchanged.
files w/bl re restitution clarification with DA
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 2 years WSP concurrent to Racine case 14CF895 and Kenosha files 13CF520 & 13CF1366; 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP, is not eligible for CIP; on ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP concurrent to ct 1 and to Racine case 14CF895 and Kenosha files 13CF520 & 13CF1366; 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP, is not eligible for CIP; deft to pay $450 DNA surcharge; DA to submit amount for restitution.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI waived.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 3/17/16 at 2pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Bielski the FPT of 2/5/16 at 8:45am is rescheduled, as the deft is unable to be brought on writ due to medical treatment; reset to 3/17/16 at 8:45am.
With Atty Bielski the FPT of 12/2/15 at 3pm is rescheduled, as the deft is undergoing medical treatment; reset to 2/5/16 at 8:45am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty D Bielski appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA McNeill states the deft was not writted for this appearance.  FPT continued to 12/2/15 at 3pm.  Bond continued.
At the request of Atty Bielski the FPT of 9/23/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled, to be held after sentencing date in Br 4; reset to 11/9/15 at 11am.
With Atty Bielsji the FPT of 9/22/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar; reset to 9/23/15 at 8:45am.

With Atty Bielski the FPT of 8/12/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled; as the case is resolved, but would like to proceed after sentencing in Br 4 who is waiting until a Racine sentencing is completed; reset to 9/22/15 at 8:45am.

With Atty Bielski the FPT of 6/30/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled; as the deft failed drug court and will be sentenced in Br 4, is also waiting on a definitive offer in this case that may be waiting on results of sentencing; reset to 8/12/15 at 8:45am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Don Bielski. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-30-15 @ 8:45am with co-def in 15CM621. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
Atty Donald Bielski

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Don Bielski. Clerk LE. Atty. Bielski requests adjournment, has he just found out about this case last night. Court grants adjournment. Time limits waived by def. and tolled by court. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 6-5-15 @ 9:30am. Bond continued.

117 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco Defilippis.  Clk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  5/27/15 @ 915 a.m.   $5000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*No Contact w/Roberto E G or his residence & Pick-n-Save
